response.overview: The film revolves around Mary Katherine, who runs a printing shop and grapples with the challenges of publishing a letter that suggests accepting British peace proposals during a time of revolution. The conversation highlights the tension between loyalty to the cause of independence and the desire for peace. Mary Katherine refuses to reveal the identity of the letter's author, which angers local patriots. The scene also touches on themes of gender roles, as Mary Katherine expresses her reluctance to conform to traditional expectations of women, emphasizing her independence and determination.
response.title: Mary Kate's War
